Description: Two joining fragments of wall of Attic black-figured pottery cup; interior glazed. Exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of female figure seated to left (chair legs and clothed rump, legs, and feet remaining; added red on chiton with incised decorative crosses and added white on feet); trace of furniture leg; at right, uncertain motif with added white; below, black lines and bands above tongue pattern alternating in outline and solid black.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Piekarski compares the sherd to Boston 88.829 which is since lost. The sherd was published by Fairbanks 1928, p. 124, no. 350.2, pl. XXXVIII as Laconian.
Bibliographic references: Piekarski 2001 / Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn (p. 32, no. A 35, pl. 9, no. 3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1547) (Phase 3)
